DataElement.preferredName: Administration, Management Performed Study Activity Delay Duration ISO21090.PQ.TIME.v1.0
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The completed activity within the context of a given study that is not directly related to the study's overarching hypothesis evaluation or testing, but is nonetheless essential to the efficient and/or effective coordination and execution of the study. EXAMPLE(S): assignment to a treatment arm, registration to a study, start of on-study period, end of on-study period, obtain informed consent, verify eligibility criteria, enroll, randomize, complete study visits, exit trial, break treatment blind, protocol violation, premature withdrawal. The period of time that an action is delayed relative to an original schedule. EXAMPLE(S): If a substance administration is delayed 2 days as a result of an adverse event, then the delayDuration is 2 days.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Administration, Management Performed Study Activity Delay Duration
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Performing or possessing executive duties; acting as a supervisor or manager.:Executed and carried through to completion.:A detailed examination, analysis, or critical inspection of a subject designed to discover facts about it.:An action taken in pursuit of an objective; the state of being active._Time during which some action is awaited; inactivity resulting in something being put off until a later time; the state of being slower or later.:The period of time during which something continues.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Performing or possessing executive duties; acting as a supervisor or manager.:Executed and carried through to completion.:A detailed examination, analysis, or critical inspection of a subject designed to discover facts about it.:An action taken in pursuit of an objective; the state of being active.

Concepts.definition: Performing or possessing executive duties; acting as a supervisor or manager.
Executed and carried through to completion.
A detailed examination, analysis, or critical inspection of a subject designed to discover facts about it.
An active process; excludes processes and mechanisms which fulfill biological functions.

Property.preferredDefinition: Time during which some action is awaited; inactivity resulting in something being put off until a later time; the state of being slower or later.:The period of time during which something continues.
